Build 200405171219
Win2k

I was just poking around in my target Eclipse when the following exception 
occurred. Based on the stack trace, it looks like I had an Ant editor open, but 
I don't remember when I was doing when this happened. After this exception 
occurred, the workbench was frozen.

My workspace just has the org.eclipse.debug.ui plugin. I can still reproduce this on M9. I'm running 
on an old workspace (the folder shows 20031205), which might be causing the problem. 
Workspace available upon request.
Jeff can you give me some pointers on how this could happen. Thanks.

This happens when they same classloader is asked to load (define) the same 
class twice.  Typcially this is guarded by loading being in a locked region and 
checking the classloader cache before attempting to define the class again.

It is quite possible that the use of an old workspace *3.0* based workspace is 
affecting things but that seems odd.  

Having the workspace would be interesting.  Please strip any confidential info 
(passwords etc) and post.  Also, any steps to reproduce.
